book_title: Dynamic Declarer Play - Virtual European Championship part 1
author: Krzysztof Martens
main_technique: Combine all your chances and remember to maintain communication
key_insight: Prudent play of the clubs will allow you to finesse hearts twice
solution_summary: 1. Win a trick in the hand. 2-3. A club to the king and a club to the ace. If it turns out that South holds Q-10-8-2 in the club suit, you will be in the right hand to take your second chance in hearts, finessing the queen. Prudent play of the clubs will allow you to finesse hearts twice.
making_contract: Contract 3NT, one off: +100 for NS. You played maintaining the communication: +12 IMP.
alternate_result: You did not think about it: no swing.
educational_value: Learn to combine multiple chances while maintaining proper entries and communication between hands

book_title: Dynamic Declarer Play - Virtual European Championship part 1
author: Krzysztof Martens
key_insight: Play a diamond to the jack in the second trick - your best chance is that South holds the king-queen
solution_summary: Play a diamond to the jack in the second trick – your best chance is that South holds the king-queen. This is difficult because in your imagination you see the layouts: K-10, Q-10, K-Q offside. Playing the ace of diamonds gives around a 5% chance to win the contract. The worst possible move is to play the nine.
making_contract: Contract 4♠ +620 for EW. A diamond to the jack: −1 IMP
educational_value: Learn to calculate odds and make percentage plays even when they seem counterintuitive

book_title: Dynamic Declarer Play - Virtual European Championship part 1
author: Krzysztof Martens
key_insight: Win with the jack of diamonds, play a diamond to the king, get back to you hand with the king of clubs, play a club to the ten
solution_summary: 1. Win with the jack of diamonds. 2. Play a diamond to the king. 3. Get back to you hand with the king of clubs. 4. Play a club to the ten. In this way we maintain communications and can score a trick with the ace of diamonds. The opponents may establish only three spade tricks at the most.
making_contract: Contract 3NT +400 for EW. Safety play has brought you no swing board.
educational_value: Learn the importance of preserving communications between hands and making safety plays

book_title: Dynamic Declarer Play - Virtual European Championship part 1
author: Krzysztof Martens
key_insight: 2. A club to the nine (South may play the king or hesitate). 4. The ace of clubs and play for a club-spade squeeze or spade finesse
solution_summary: Order of play: 2. A club to the nine (South may play the king or hesitate). 4. The ace of clubs and play for a club-spade squeeze or spade finesse. You combined the chance of a favourable location of the jack of clubs, king of club doubleton in either hand or a spade finesse.
making_contract: Contract 6NT, +990 for EW. You have made the contract: no swing.
alternate_result: You have not combined your chances: −14 IMP.
educational_value: Learn to combine multiple chances including finesses, suit breaks, and squeeze possibilities

book_title: Dynamic Declarer Play - Virtual European Championship part 1
author: Krzysztof Martens
main_technique: Plan the communications in your play. Do not give up just because you are in a poor contract
key_insight: Win the trick with the king of clubs and pitch your heart. Play the spade to the jack
solution_summary: 1. Win the trick with the king of clubs and pitch your heart. 2. Play the spade to the jack. Why? This is typical chess problem. If you try to establish a heart you will not have enough entries to lead towards your spade honours twice. The odds for the ace and queen of spades with the South are 25%. If South has only the queen then you have to find a 3-3 heart break.
making_contract: a pair from San Marino stopped quite rightly in 3NT. Result 12 tricks, +690 for EW. You played a spade to the jack and on the second trick: +12 IMP.
alternate_result: You tried to establish hearts: −13 IMP.
educational_value: Learn to make the best percentage play even in poor contracts and manage entries effectively

book_title: Dynamic Declarer Play - Virtual European Championship part 1
author: Krzysztof Martens
main_technique: Once again, you need to play a poor contract in the best possible way
key_insight: Run the jack of spades on the second trick. If the queen is onside, play the ace of diamonds next (a safety play against a single king of diamonds)
solution_summary: Run the jack of spades on the second trick. If the queen is onside, play the ace of diamonds next (a safety play against a single king of diamonds). If the spade finesse fails, you may still find the king of diamonds doubleton onside.
making_contract: Contract 6♠ +920 for EW. You played accurately: no swing.
alternate_result: You failed to make the slam: −14 IMP.
educational_value: Learn to make safety plays and find the best line in poor contracts by combining chances

book_title: Dynamic Declarer Play - Virtual European Championship part 1
author: Krzysztof Martens
main_technique: Try to combine all your chances
key_insight: 3-5. Cash the ace and king of hearts and ruff a heart. If hearts break 3-3 you can play the dummy reversal. If instead heart break 4-2, then the spades must be 3-3
solution_summary: Order of play: 3-5. Cash the ace and king of hearts and ruff a heart. If hearts break 3-3 you can play the dummy reversal. If instead heart break 4-2, then the spades must be 3-3.
making_contract: Closed room: 3NT +430 for EW. Establishing the hearts (finding them 3-3) and a dummy reversal: +10 IMP.
educational_value: Learn dummy reversal technique and how to combine chances with heart establishment

book_title: Dynamic Declarer Play - Virtual European Championship part 1
author: Krzysztof Martens
main_technique: Play one suit to leave you the best remaining chance in another suit
key_insight: 1-2. Ace of heart and a diamond to the ace. 3-4. A club to dummy and a diamond to the queen
solution_summary: Order of play: 1-2. Ace of heart and a diamond to the ace. 3-4. A club to dummy and a diamond to the queen. The unfavourable diamond break will not prevent you from making the contract. 5-6. A spade to the ace and finesse the jack of spades of spades. This way you manage to collect 12 tricks.
making_contract: Contract 6♥, +1370 for EW. You made 6NT: +2 IMP.
alternate_result: You took another line of play: −16 IMP.
educational_value: Learn to play suits in correct order to preserve options and handle bad breaks

book_title: Dynamic Declarer Play - Virtual European Championship part 1
author: Krzysztof Martens
main_technique: You do not know which way to finesse ♥10? It does not really matter, the opponents will do the job for you
key_insight: Win the spade lead with the king, play four rounds of diamonds and then exit with ace and another spade. After cashing one more spade trick, the defenders will have to play hearts or clubs, giving you a seventh trick
solution_summary: Win the spade lead with the king, play four rounds of diamonds and then exit with ace and another spade. After cashing one more spade trick, the defenders will have to play hearts or clubs, giving you a seventh trick.
making_contract: You team-mates, playing NS, went down in 2♠. Result: +50 for EW. You played correctly in 1NT: +1 IMP.
educational_value: Learn endplay techniques and how to let the opponents do the work for you

book_title: Dynamic Declarer Play - Virtual European Championship part 1
author: Krzysztof Martens
main_technique: Make the dangerous opponent pay a high price for gaining the lead
key_insight: It is immaterial whether South plays the jack or not. He is the dangerous opponent for you
solution_summary: Order of play: 2-3. Play the ace and king of clubs 4. If club break 3-2, overtake the jack with the queen and play a heart. a) if South raises with the ace, you have three heart tricks (the ♣5 will let you enter the dummy), b) if you win the heart trick, switch to the diamonds.
making_contract: Contract 3NT +400 for EW. Good play: – no swing.
alternate_result: Wrong play: −10 IMP. Faultless declarer play will earn you +47 IMP = 24-6 VP.
educational_value: Learn to identify the dangerous opponent and force them to make losing plays
